meanings.definition: The part of a coal mine where coal is being extracted.
meanings.sent1: Miners work hard at the coalface to dig out the coal.
meanings.sent2: The workers at the coalface are responsible for getting the coal out of the mine.
meanings.sent3: At the coalface, the miners found a surprise pocket of coal that made them all cheer.
meanings.sent4: The coalface of the mine was like a treasure trove waiting to be uncovered.
meanings.sent5: The darkness and dust at the coalface made it a challenging but rewarding place to work.

meanings.definition: The forefront or most active part of a job or activity.
meanings.sent1: In the project team, Sarah is always at the coalface, leading the way.
meanings.sent2: The sales team is the coalface of the company, interacting directly with customers.
meanings.sent3: At the meeting, John's enthusiasm put him at the coalface of the discussion.
meanings.sent4: The charity event was the coalface of community involvement, bringing everyone together.
meanings.sent5: Being at the coalface of innovation means constantly pushing boundaries and trying new ideas.
